body_html: @Ariel-Lieberman unistd is used to get information about available system memory (https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/common_runtime/mkl_cpu_allocator.h#L71). You can work around it by replacing with equivalent functionality on windows. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2513505/how-to-get-available-memory-c-g provides one possible option.

body: @Ariel-Lieberman unistd is used to get information about available system memory (https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/common_runtime/mkl_cpu_allocator.h#L71). You can work around it by replacing with equivalent functionality on windows. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2513505/how-to-get-available-memory-c-g provides one possible option.
